initial_question.title: chinese language code
initial_question.body:
Thank you for your open-source project. I am currently doing some testing and saw the definition of supported_language_codes in conditioning.py, 

supported_language_codes = [
    'af', 'am', 'an', 'ar', 'as', 'az', 'ba', 'bg', 'bn', 'bpy', 'bs', 'ca', 'cmn',
    'cs', 'cy', 'da', 'de', 'el', 'en-029', 'en-gb', 'en-gb-scotland', 'en-gb-x-gbclan',
    'en-gb-x-gbcwmd', 'en-gb-x-rp', 'en-us', 'eo', 'es', 'es-419', 'et', 'eu', 'fa',
    'fa-latn', 'fi', 'fr-be', 'fr-ch', 'fr-fr', 'ga', 'gd', 'gn', 'grc', 'gu', 'hak',
    'hi', 'hr', 'ht', 'hu', 'hy', 'hyw', 'ia', 'id', 'is', 'it', 'ja', 'jbo', 'ka',
    'kk', 'kl', 'kn', 'ko', 'kok', 'ku', 'ky', 'la', 'lfn', 'lt', 'lv', 'mi', 'mk',
    'ml', 'mr', 'ms', 'mt', 'my', 'nb', 'nci', 'ne', 'nl', 'om', 'or', 'pa', 'pap',
    'pl', 'pt', 'pt-br', 'py', 'quc', 'ro', 'ru', 'ru-lv', 'sd', 'shn', 'si', 'sk',
    'sl', 'sq', 'sr', 'sv', 'sw', 'ta', 'te', 'tn', 'tr', 'tt', 'ur', 'uz', 'vi',
    'vi-vn-x-central', 'vi-vn-x-south', 'yue'
]

but I’m not sure which one represents Chinese. I tried cs, but it seems incorrect. Could you please help me confirm this? Thank you.

satisfaction_conditions: Correct language code is used for Chinese language variants
Distinction between Chinese variants is clear
Selected language code exists in supported_language_codes list

initial_question.title: How do I prevent Zonos from adding reverb to the generated audio
initial_question.body:
Hi!

This project is fascinating! 
Thanks alot for sharing that gem.

No, how can I prevent Zonos from adding reverb to the generated audio.

Thanks :)

satisfaction_conditions: Solution maintains basic audio generation functionality
Input speaker reference quality impacts reverb presence
Solution can be applied before or during the audio generation process
